results.title: Effect of antihypertensive therapy on weight loss. The Trial of Antihypertensive Interventions and Management Research Group.
results.text_hl: The drug effect on weight change, present in all groups at 6 months, was most pronounced in those randomly assigned to the @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@ diet, where the placebo group lost 4.4 kg, the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group lost 3.0 kg, and the @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ group lost 6.9 kg.

citations.NLM: Davis BR, Oberman A, Blaufox MD, Wassertheil-Smoller S, Hawkins CM, Cutler JA, Zimbaldi N, Langford HG. Effect of antihypertensive therapy on weight loss. The Trial of Antihypertensive Interventions and Management Research Group. Hypertension. 1992 Apr;19(4):393-9. PMID: 1555871
citations.BibTeX: @article{1555871, title={Effect of antihypertensive therapy on weight loss. The Trial of Antihypertensive Interventions and Management Research Group.}, author={Davis BR and Oberman A and Blaufox MD and Wassertheil-Smoller S and Hawkins CM and Cutler JA and Zimbaldi N and Langford HG}, journal={Hypertension}, volume={19}, number={4}, pages={393-9}}

results.title: The Trial of Antihypertensive Interventions and Management (TAIM) Study. Final results with regard to blood pressure, cardiovascular risk, and quality of life.
results.text_hl: Blacks were more responsive to @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ plus @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@ and whites to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ plus @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@.

citations.NLM: Wassertheil-Smoller S, Oberman A, Blaufox MD, Davis B, Langford H. The Trial of Antihypertensive Interventions and Management (TAIM) Study. Final results with regard to blood pressure, cardiovascular risk, and quality of life. Am J Hypertens. 1992 Jan;5(1):37-44. PMID: 1736933
citations.BibTeX: @article{1736933, title={The Trial of Antihypertensive Interventions and Management (TAIM) Study. Final results with regard to blood pressure, cardiovascular risk, and quality of life.}, author={Wassertheil-Smoller S and Oberman A and Blaufox MD and Davis B and Langford H}, journal={Am J Hypertens}, volume={5}, number={1}, pages={37-44}}

results.title: Controlled trial on three beta-blockers: antihypertensive efficacy and effect on the hypertensive heart disease.
results.text_hl: Treatment of 66 @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with three different beta-blockers (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 100 mg once a day; @CHEMICAL_Oxprenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010096 @@@oxprenolol@@@ 80 mg twice a day; @CHEMICAL_Nadolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009248 @@@nadolol@@@ 80 mg once a day) for six months resulted in a significant @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@reduction@@@ in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@blood pressure@@@ and heart rate, the maximum with @CHEMICAL_Nadolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009248 @@@nadolol@@@, a significant amelioration in pre-ejection period/left ventricular ejection time ratio expressing the haemodynamic performance of the left ventricle with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Nadolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009248 @@@nadolol@@@, and a significant @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@reduction@@@ @DISEASE_Hypertrophy_Left_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017379 @@@left ventricular hypertrophy@@@ as expressed by the Romhilt-Estes index with all three drugs, but especially with @CHEMICAL_Nadolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009248 @@@nadolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Pupita F, Ansuini R, Belogi M, Pupita G, Gaggi S. Controlled trial on three beta-blockers: antihypertensive efficacy and effect on the hypertensive heart disease. Int J Clin Pharmacol Res. 1985;5(6):439-45. PMID: 2869001
citations.BibTeX: @article{2869001, title={Controlled trial on three beta-blockers: antihypertensive efficacy and effect on the hypertensive heart disease.}, author={Pupita F and Ansuini R and Belogi M and Pupita G and Gaggi S}, journal={Int J Clin Pharmacol Res}, volume={5}, number={6}, pages={439-45}}

results.title: Effect of antihypertensives on sexual function and quality of life: the TAIM Study.
results.text_hl: INTERVENTION: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ were stratified by clinical center and race and were randomly assigned to one of three diets (usual, low-@CHEMICAL_Sodium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012964 @@@sodium@@@ and high-@CHEMICAL_Potassium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011188 @@@potassium@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@) and one of three agents (placebo, @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@).

citations.NLM: Wassertheil-Smoller S, Blaufox MD, Oberman A, Davis BR, Swencionis C, Knerr MO, Hawkins CM, Langford HG. Effect of antihypertensives on sexual function and quality of life: the TAIM Study. Ann Intern Med. 1991 Apr 15;114(8):613-20. PMID: 2003706
citations.BibTeX: @article{2003706, title={Effect of antihypertensives on sexual function and quality of life: the TAIM Study.}, author={Wassertheil-Smoller S and Blaufox MD and Oberman A and Davis BR and Swencionis C and Knerr MO and Hawkins CM and Langford HG}, journal={Ann Intern Med}, volume={114}, number={8}, pages={613-20}}

results.title: Effect of beta 1-adrenoceptor blockade in rats at 5 bar ambient pressure.
results.text_hl: In spite of @GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_24925 @@@beta 1-adrenoceptor@@@ blockade, ambient pressure rise increased HR, LVP, +dP/dt, -dP/dt, TMBF, and calculated cardiac O2 consumption (P < 0.05). A second @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ injection at 5 bar caused a brief @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Loss</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@reduction@@@ in HR but did not affect cardiac contractility.

citations.NLM: Risberg J, Hordnes C, Stuhr LE, Tyssebotn I. Effect of beta 1-adrenoceptor blockade in rats at 5 bar ambient pressure. Undersea Hyperb Med. 1994 Dec;21(4):371-85. PMID: 8000277
citations.BibTeX: @article{8000277, title={Effect of beta 1-adrenoceptor blockade in rats at 5 bar ambient pressure.}, author={Risberg J and Hordnes C and Stuhr LE and Tyssebotn I}, journal={Undersea Hyperb Med}, volume={21}, number={4}, pages={371-85}}

results.title: Beta-adrenoceptor activity and resting energy metabolism in weight losing cancer patients.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Carbohydrates @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002241 @@@Carbohydrate@@@ oxidation was increased by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and decreased by @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, whilst fat oxidation was decreased by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and unchanged by @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Hyltander A, Daneryd P, Sandström R, Körner U, Lundholm K. Beta-adrenoceptor activity and resting energy metabolism in weight losing cancer patients. Eur J Cancer. 2000 Feb;36(3):330-4. PMID: 10708933
citations.BibTeX: @article{10708933, title={Beta-adrenoceptor activity and resting energy metabolism in weight losing cancer patients.}, author={Hyltander A and Daneryd P and Sandström R and Körner U and Lundholm K}, journal={Eur J Cancer}, volume={36}, number={3}, pages={330-4}}
